page.title: 02A Typical Farm In Our Area.
page.content: Allergill Farm measures 222 acres. Grass is the only crop grown, 3/4 is pastureland and 1/4 is meadowland. The farm has three tractors, but contractors are hired to do the ploughing. Round hay bales are made, not rectangular. The cubicle shed,where the cows are kept,is the most important building.The cattle are kept for beef, not milk. The farmer buys his cattle from Hexham. He has 64 cows, but only one bull. The cows are Fresians and the bull is Charolais. They are fed on silage and hay in the winter. The average number of sheep kept is four hundred ewes and six rams. The farmer has only one breed which is Blue Faced Leicester. He sells the lambs to a butcher for meat. He has problems with stray dogs and foxes worrying his lambs.
